column4: how can I run an x-executable from terminal if it's in a random folder that I placed in "home"?
so if I'm in terminal and I want to type "adb" and want to have it start
if you put it in /usr/bin it will be accessible without a path
It's part of Android_SDK. Wouldn't it have to stay in the oringinal folder?
you can add the path to the binary to the end of your PATH if you want. Probably better
Is that the "PATH=$PATH"  that you are refferencing to?
And that will allow everything executable in that folder to be run from the terminal?
without using the full path, yes
Now when I run the file it says. Insufficent permissions, but I've tried sudo and root..
Disregard. It's permissions for the device
is the file marked as executable?
i read it wrong. it was the device that i was having an issue with. I figured it out
